title.narrative: 5.3 VULNERABLE CHILDREN PRACTICE KEY HYGIENE BEHAVIOURS AND WATER CONSERVATION

description.narrative: Vulnerable children practice key hygiene behaviors and water conservation., which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable people have access to safe drinking water, clean environment, and key hygiene/water conservation practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable children practice key hygiene behaviors and water conservation.

description.narrative: Critical and rapid behavior change activities continued in vulnerable communities with UNICEF Jordan direct support while community mobilization and hygiene awareness escalated particularly in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. While concrete evidence is yet to be collected, anecdotal feedback from communities regarding hygiene practices has shown significant shift in behavior towards increased personal hygiene, handwashing, and household cleaning as a result of extensive Risk Communication and Community engagement campaigns. UNICEF Jordan is currently supporting several initiatives for elevating climate change discussion through youth-led evidence generation and active engagement. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/08/2020

title.narrative: % increase of target vulnerable children who demonstrate an awareness of key hygiene messages and water conservation

baseline.value: 40% of children correctly name three water conservation practices, 70% of children correctly name three diarrhoea prevention methods

title.narrative: % of students in UNICEF targeted schools who demonstrate awareness of key hygeine messages and water conservation
